page.title: 01SOUTH AND EAST OF SELBY
page.content: The area is to the South and East of the market town of{Selby,}and includes the Eastern half of{Brayton}village. The land is very flat rising to a height of only 8m. 1/3 is residential, a mixture of private and council housing, and 2/3 agricultural, mainly arable land, with some grazing of beef cattle. Crops are mainly{barley, {wheat, sugar beet, potatoes, peas & {rape.}The country landscape contains few trees in small woods, few hedgerows and large fields. Most of the housing is semi-detached and much of it built since 1960. The Abbot's Road area is largely Council housing. The major employers are Rigid Paper Products, Middlebrook Mushrooms, Yorkshire Chemicals, Sturge's Chemicals and Selby District Council.
